name: GetReturnableStatusForOrder
description:
Gets whether or not an Order is currently returnable.

For each OrderLine on the Order you'll get back a result that specifies whether or not it can be returned,
how much can be returned and which (if any) other OrderLines must be returned before the line itself can be returned
(think of parent-child lines where you can't return a child OrderLine without also returning the parent OrderLine).

In addition, this service may return `ReturnSets` which specify that 'if you return these OrderLines (specified by `OrderLineIDs`) then
you must *also* return these lines (specified by `RequiredOrderLineIDsToReturn`). For example, if you return all normal OrderLines on an Order
then you must also return all the free products you have received.

Finally, specify the `ReturningQuantities` parameter as an object where the key is an `OrderLineID` with a (positive) `Quantity` you wish to be
returned. The `Result` can be affected in case rules have been configured to, for example, allow _returns without products_ only when the total
return order amount is below a certain amount.
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Customer` or `Api`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-BackendSystemID
headers.description: The ID of the backend system that is used to resolve the IDs.

request_samples.name: CURL

B.name: OrderID
B.description: This is the ID of a `Order`

B.name: ReturningQuantities
B.description: This is the ID of a `OrderLine`

D.name: Code
D.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

D.name: Message
D.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

D.name: RequestID
D.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

D.name: Type
D.description: A short description of the error type.

E.name: ExternalIDs
E.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

E.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
E.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

E.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
E.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.

G.name: Scope
G.description:
Flags enum, combine any of the below values:

* `0` - None
* `1` - Create
* `2` - Edit
* `4` - Delete
* `8` - View
* `31` - Manage
* `32` - Settings
* `64` - Scripting
* `127` - All

F.name: MustBeReturnedWithOrderLineIDs
F.description:
When present, this OrderLine can only be returned when the OrderLines specified in this collection are also being returned.

This is the ID of a `OrderLine`

F.name: OrderLineID
F.description: This is the ID of a `OrderLine`

F.name: OrderLineType
F.description:
Possible values:

* `0` - NormalProduct
* `1` - Discount
* `2` - ExtraCosts
* `5` - ShippingCosts
* `6` - ReturnCosts
* `7` - PriceCorrection
* `8` - Service
* `9` - GiftWrappingCosts
* `10` - DownPayment

F.name: SerialNumberConfigurationID
F.description: This is the ID of a `SerialNumberConfiguration`

H.name: OrderLineIDs
H.description: This is the ID of a `OrderLine`

H.name: RequiredOrderLineIDsToReturn
H.description: This is the ID of a `OrderLine`

I.name: OrganizationUnitID
I.description: This is the ID of a `OrganizationUnit`

I.name: Reason
I.description:
Possible values:

* `0` - CurrentOrganizationUnit
* `1` - ShipFromOrganizationUnit
* `2` - SupplierOrganizationUnit
* `3` - ReturnOrganizationUnit
* `4` - SoldFromOrganizationUnit

C.name: RequiresSpecialInStoreReturn
C.description: Indicates whether the order needs to use the special return procedure for in-store returns. This is done using the `CreateInStoreReturn` service.
